title: Playing With Python
description: This post is just me playing around with learning Python.
contents:
I have a good handle on R scrip but i wanted to learn python to round out my skills.
I am following an example from Maven Analytics course Python Foundations for Data Analysis

import pandas

def tax_calculator(subtotal, sales_tax):
    """ takes in a subtotal and tax rate and returns total sale
    
    Args:
        subtotal (float): cost of transaction
        sales_tax (float): tax rate at store location
    Returns:
        float: total amount owed
    
    """
    total = subtotal + (subtotal * sales_tax)
    return total

totalsale = tax_calculator(100, .06)

print(totalsale)
106.0

R Script Version


Rtax_calculator <- function(subtotal, sales_tax){
  total = subtotal + (subtotal*sales_tax)
  
}

totalsaleR <- Rtax_calculator(100,.06)

print(totalsaleR)

[1] 106

title: How I created This Blog
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
Distill is a publication format for scientific and technical writing, native to the web.
Learn more about using Distill at https://rstudio.github.io/distill.
The links below are what i followed to build this blog. Iâ€™m not going to lie to you. This was hard to create, but I learned a lot in the process. In order to get this website launched, I had to learn the distill package, GIT / Github work flows and some basic web design. The beauty is that now that I finally have this site setup and working, now i can truly begin to learn and show my skills.
A big benefit to using R Markdown and Distill is keeping your cost low. So far my only cost has been buying the domain name.
https://themockup.blog/posts/2020-08-01-building-a-blog-with-distill/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZOBXGxPH3Zo
Cheat Sheets R Markdown 
+https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet
+https://www.rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rmarkdown-cheatsheet.pdf
HTML 
+https://web.stanford.edu/group/csp/cs21/htmlcheatsheet.pdf
+https://htmlcheatsheet.com/
Distill is a publication format for scientific and technical writing, native to the web.
Learn more about using Distill at https://rstudio.github.io/distill.

title: Welcome to Tim Sheehan Data Professional
description:
Welcome to my new blog, Tim Sheehan Data Professional. I hope you enjoy 
reading what I have to say!
contents:

Hi, My name is Tim Sheehan. Welcome to my personal website. This site is 1 part portfolio and 1 part me playing around. I hope you find something of value that will enrich your life.
I am passionate about helping people and about data analytics.
